trans-unit.source: Enacting configurations
trans-unit.target: Enacting configurations

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to enact PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) configurations: push mode and pull mode.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to enact PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) configurations: push mode and pull mode.

trans-unit.source: Push mode
trans-unit.target: Push mode

trans-unit.source: ![Push mode](images/Push.png "How push mode works")
trans-unit.target: ![Push mode](images/Push.png "How push mode works")

trans-unit.source: Push mode refers to a user actively applying a configuration to a target node by calling the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Push mode refers to a user actively applying a configuration to a target node by calling the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: After creating and compiling a configuration, you can enact it in push mode by calling the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) cmdlet, setting the -Path parameter of the cmdlet to the path where the configuration MOF is located.
trans-unit.target: After creating and compiling a configuration, you can enact it in push mode by calling the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) cmdlet, setting the -Path parameter of the cmdlet to the path where the configuration MOF is located.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the configuration MOF is locted at `C:\DSC\Configurations\localhost.mof`, you would apply it to the local machine with the following command: `Start-DscConfiguration -Path 'C:\DSC\Configurations'`
trans-unit.target: For example, if the configuration MOF is locted at `C:\DSC\Configurations\localhost.mof`, you would apply it to the local machine with the following command: `Start-DscConfiguration -Path 'C:\DSC\Configurations'`

trans-unit.source: __Note__: By default, DSC runs a configuration as a background job.
trans-unit.target: __Note__: By default, DSC runs a configuration as a background job.

trans-unit.source: To run the configuration interactively, call the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) with the __-Wait__ parameter.
trans-unit.target: To run the configuration interactively, call the [Start-DscConfiguration](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn521623.aspx) with the __-Wait__ parameter.

trans-unit.source: Cloud deployment engines typically leverage Pull Mode inside of a broader deployment solution.
trans-unit.target: Cloud deployment engines typically leverage Pull Mode inside of a broader deployment solution.

trans-unit.source: For example, Microsoft Azure provides a [DSC Extension](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-extensions-features/) for virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: For example, Microsoft Azure provides a [DSC Extension](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/virtual-machines-extensions-features/) for virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: This provides an option to include a configuration script and all required DSC modules in an archive file that is extracted and executed within a virtual machine as part of a deployment.
trans-unit.target: This provides an option to include a configuration script and all required DSC modules in an archive file that is extracted and executed within a virtual machine as part of a deployment.

trans-unit.source: Pull mode
trans-unit.target: Pull mode

trans-unit.source: ![Pull Mode](images/Pull.png "How pull mode works") In pull mode, pull clients are configured to get their desired state configurations from a remote pull server.
trans-unit.target: ![Pull Mode](images/Pull.png "How pull mode works") In pull mode, pull clients are configured to get their desired state configurations from a remote pull server.

trans-unit.source: Likewise, the pull server has been set up to host the DSC service, and has been provisioned with the configurations and resources that are required by the pull clients.
trans-unit.target: Likewise, the pull server has been set up to host the DSC service, and has been provisioned with the configurations and resources that are required by the pull clients.

trans-unit.source: Each one of the pull clients has a scheduled task that performs a periodic compliance check on the configuration of the node.
trans-unit.target: Each one of the pull clients has a scheduled task that performs a periodic compliance check on the configuration of the node.

trans-unit.source: When the event is triggered the first time, it causes the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) on the pull client to validate the configuration.
trans-unit.target: When the event is triggered the first time, it causes the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) on the pull client to validate the configuration.

trans-unit.source: If the pull client is configured as desired, nothing happens.
trans-unit.target: If the pull client is configured as desired, nothing happens.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the LCM makes a request to the pull server to get a given configuration.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the LCM makes a request to the pull server to get a given configuration.

trans-unit.source: If that configuration exists on the pull server, and it passes initial validation checks, the configuration is transmitted to the pull client, where it is then executed by the LCM.
trans-unit.target: If that configuration exists on the pull server, and it passes initial validation checks, the configuration is transmitted to the pull client, where it is then executed by the LCM.

trans-unit.source: For more information on deploying a DSC Pull Server on premises, see the DSC Pull Server Configuration and Planning Guide.
trans-unit.target: For more information on deploying a DSC Pull Server on premises, see the DSC Pull Server Configuration and Planning Guide.

trans-unit.source: If you would prefer to take advantage of an online service to host Pull Server functionality, see the [Azure Automation DSC](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/automation-dsc-overview/) service.
trans-unit.target: If you would prefer to take advantage of an online service to host Pull Server functionality, see the [Azure Automation DSC](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/automation-dsc-overview/) service.

trans-unit.target: The following topics explain how to set up pull servers and clients:

trans-unit.target: [Setting up a web pull server](pullServer.md)

trans-unit.target: [Setting up an SMB pull server](pullServerSMB.md)

trans-unit.target: [Configuring a pull client](pullClientConfigID.md)
